original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs90bn in T-bill auction, yields rise across maturities
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasuries yields rose across maturities at Wednesday’s auction which sold 90 billion rupees of Treasury bills, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 54.7 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.65 percent, up 85 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 40 billion rupees.
Only 9 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 24.97 percent, up 87 basis points from a week earlier after offering 25 billion rupees.
25.3 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 22.96 percent, up 32 basis points from a week earlier after offering 25 billion. (Colombo/April19/2022)
